oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Drugs used for Chemical Restraint in Animals
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Muir, William W.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: chemical restraint
pharmacokinetic activity
pharmacologic effects
cardiovascular system.
drug effects
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The development and use of drugs for chemical restraint in animals has increased considerably during the past 10 years. Many of these drugs offer definite advantages compared to previously available compounds. In order to utilize these compounds safely, their pharmacokinetic activity, pharmacologic effects, and adverse side effects must be determined in a multitude of animal species. The purpose of this brief manuscript will be to describe current information relating to the metabolism, elimination and pharmacology of drugs used for chemical restraint in animals. The discussion will emphasize drug effects upon the cardiovascular system.
